results.title: Controlling behavior through reinforcement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Schedules of conditioning thorugh reinforcement are illustrated with pigeons in Skinner apparatus and their applications to human behaviour are indicated. Demonstrates the effects of: (1) fixed rate reinforcement which results in a high work output; (2) variable intervals resulting in the falling off of output; (3) variable interval reinforcement which causes continuous output at a high rate and persists after reinforcement discontinues.
results.description:

results.title: Common fallacies about group differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
A painter working in a classroom makes a statement about the French race and Latin temperament. A professor, over-hearing his remark, tries to correct his misconceptions. Among other facts, he points out that a nation is not a race, that members of a group are never “all anything”, that group behaviour cannot be judged by isolated cases.

results.title: The Brain and behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Demonstrates two ways in which the function of different brain areas can be studied. One method is to stimulate different parts of the living brain with an electrode. The other is to measure the changes in behaviour following injuries to different areas of the brain.
results.description:

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Part of the “Physical science study committee series” presents experimental evidence that the work done on a body, measured as the area under the force-distance curve, is a measure of the transfer of kinetic energy to the body calculated from its mass and velocity. Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.

results.title: Inertia
results.creator_credit: Physical Sciences Study Committee and Educational Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Edward M. Purcell demonstrates Galileo’s principle of inertia in experiments with a body moving horizontally with minimal friction and using low friction dry-ice pucks and multiple flash photography showing acceleration is proportional to force when mass is constant. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Speed of light
results.creator_credit: Stephen White, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Shows the measuring of the speed of light in air at night, using a spark-gap, a photocell, parabolic mirrors and an oscilloscope. Also studies the speed of light in air and water in a laboratory, using a high-speed rotation mirror.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen White, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Shows the measuring of the speed of light in air at night, using a spark-gap, a photocell, parabolic mirrors and an oscilloscope. Also studies the speed of light in air and water in a laboratory, using a high-speed rotation mirror.

results.title: Vector kinematics
results.creator_credit: Jack Churchill, Kevin Smith and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”
Displacement, velocity and acceleration vectors are demonstrated for circular, simple harmonic and other two-dimensional motions, displayed visually on a cathode ray tube screen by an electronic computer. Francis L. Friedman discusses their relationships.

results.title: Coulomb's law
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the inverse square relationship between electric force and distance and shows that electric force is directly proportional to charge.

results.title: Universal gravitation
results.creator_credit: Jack Churchill, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”
Defines the law of universal gravitation by visualising a solar system of one star and one planet. Demonstrates the kinematics and dynamics of planetary motion. Uses a digital computer to display satellite orbits.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Elastic collisions and stored energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the concept of stored energy. Uses the example of collisions between two dry-ice pucks. Cylindrical magnets are mounted on the pucks, producing a repelling force, and the kinetic energy of the pucks is measured. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
